nodes.Narrative fragment: The client uses their Remote to enter banking details online on their TV.
nodes.Name: IPTV user
nodes.Issue: Client's economic circumstances are varying and often unstable. Serious impact of income variation for client. Ownership of card debated.
nodes.Participant speech: the Client can no longer get around the house, and not able to work and not able to earn money, and all sorts of things like that'; 'now we've made a very good point, the service provider issues the card but thecClient owns it.'

nodes.Narrative fragment: The clients main Card is stored at home.
nodes.Name: IPTV users Card
nodes.Issue: Usefulness of card to the client.
nodes.Participant speech: the card should be in the middle shouldn't it'

nodes.Narrative fragment: The secondary card is in the possession of the carer, and can be used up to �50
nodes.Name: IPTV users Secondary Card
nodes.Issue: Usefulness of the Secondary Card to the client, who has limited mobility, and can ask trusted intermediaries to make cash or card shopping purchases on their behalf.

nodes.Narrative fragment: The Remote is stored in a hiding place at home.
nodes.Name: IPTV users Remote
nodes.Participant speech: so we have, remote control, operates the television, out into the world, and uses the card, to purchase'; 'is the remote control part of security?'; 'it's the logon point.'

nodes.Narrative fragment: Data from the client is transmitted to the TV and online to the Bank.
nodes.Name: Data - Remote to TV
nodes.Issue: Data passes to TV only upon two-stage authentification, but PIN details can be observed by those nearby.

nodes.Narrative fragment: The TV screen displays the entered PIN as well as account details and balances.
nodes.Name: IPTV users TV
nodes.Participant speech: and it's big to them, the television, big to them.'

nodes.Narrative fragment: The clients children observe the hiding place of the Remote and Card as well as the PIN being entered.
nodes.Name: IPTV users children

nodes.Narrative fragment: The clients carer observes banking details and PIN and uses these to reset the upper limit of the Secondary Card to �250.
nodes.Name: IPTV users carer
nodes.Issue: The carer may be motivated to steal money by increasing the limit of the Secondary Card and removing funds in one go, or in stages.

nodes.Narrative fragment: The Service Provider partnership Troubleshooter actor receives an overspend alert concerning the clients account, and sets in motion a visit to the clients home in order to assess and possibly intervene in the use of the IPTV system.
nodes.Name: Troubleshooter
nodes.Issue: The LEGO modelling results in a new 'troubleshooter' operational role being discussed for the Service Provider partnership.
nodes.Participant speech: but that's an interesting point, we have a meeting on Monday, so I think I'll raise it as a possibility.'

nodes.Narrative fragment: The Banking plaform partners have an agreement with the Service Provider to send automated alerts concerning overspends and other anomalies on the clients account.
nodes.Name: Bank
nodes.Issue: Banking Platform accessed by client and Service provider. Distinction between this service and other account mechanisms.
nodes.Participant speech: because we're assuming those customers are serviced through this account, then the our account has to be there.'
